title.value: Peculiarities of the development and reproduction of some rare and endangered natural flora plants of Belarus in cultivated conditions
Особенности развития и семенного размножения некоторых редких и исчезающих растений природной флоры Беларуси в условиях культуры

subject.value: gestion de la faune et de la flore sauvages

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Titok, V.V., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Central Botanical Garden

abstract.value: The problem of the preservation of biological diversity of natural flora appears one of the most important challenges of modern science. Increase of the influence of anthropogenic factors on natural plant communities leads to destabilization of their structure and decrease of species composition of plants. Due to this some plant species become rare and endangered. Therefore, research of the rare and endangered plants in natural conditions is displaces with scientific investigation of them in the conditions of culture. It allows development practical directions aimed on conservation of the most vulnerable species. The peculiarities of the development and reproduction of six species of rare and endangered natural flora plants of Belarus in cultivated conditions are determined. Laboratory germination of the plants within different temperatures is evaluated; the influence of the term of sawing and stratification on germination level of rare and endangered plants is analyzed. It has been noted that all the examined species when exposed to routine agro-technical measures every year pass through a complete growth cycle of seasonal development, bear seeds and some of them are able to provide natural self-seed.
